title: The most addictive series of 2023 according to Le Monde's critics
summary: 'The Night Logan Woke Up,' 'Esterno notte,' 'Sambre' and 'Under Control' are some of the shows that made our list of the best series this year.

title: Dozens of celebrities denounce 'lynching' of 'sacred monster' Depardieu
summary: In an open letter in the conservative newspaper Le Figaro, 56 celebrities including Charlotte Rampling, Carla Bruni, and Pierre Richard say of the rape-accused actor: 'When people attack Gérard Depardieu in this way, they are attacking art.'

title: Ukrainian army says it retreated to outskirts of town claimed by Moscow
summary: Ukraine's commander-in-chief said his forces had pulled back to Marinka's outskirts, a day after Moscow claimed full control of the key town.

title: In India, Narendra Modi's grip on the Supreme Court
summary: The country's highest court recently confirmed the revocation of autonomy for Kashmir, a predominantly Muslim province. For human rights activists, this is yet another blow to democracy.

title: 'Time for action': Demonstrations against the Vucic regime continue in Belgrade
summary: A week after a controversial electoral victory for President Aleksandar Vucic's party, demonstrators are calling for national protests in Serbia. Moscow has accused 'the West' of wanting to destabilize 'its ally.'

title: Photographer Emin Özmen captures Turkey's turmoil
summary: For more than 15 years, this Turkish photojournalist has crisscrossed his country, capturing its key events: the war against the Kurdistan Workers' Party, the conflagration in Syria, the protest movements and more. His recent book, 'Olay,' presents images of a people caught up in history.

title: Torrential rains and landslides kill 22 in DR Congo
summary: More than 15 houses were swept away in the landslides caused by the downpours overnight and into Tuesday in Kananga, the capital of the Kasai-Central region.

title: US says it downs many drones and missiles fired by Houthi rebels over Red Sea
summary: US military forces shot down more than a dozen attack drones and several missiles fired by Yemen-based Houthi rebels at shipping in the Red Sea, the Pentagon said on Tuesday. Earlier, the rebels claimed responsibility for a missile strike on a vessel in the Red Sea and a drone attack toward Israel in solidarity with Gaza.

title: Turkey parliament committee approves Sweden's NATO bid
summary: Sweden's NATO bid has been stalled for months amid opposition from Turkey and Hungary. It was further complicated after President Recep Tayyip Erdogan linked it to Ankara's request for F-16 fighter jets from its ally the United States.

title: Failing to achieve its goals, Israel promises a 'long' war in Gaza
summary: Two months after the start of the ground invasion, the Israeli army is stepping up its operations while civilian casualties are mounting. Hamas's capabilities have been severely reduced, but it has not been dismantled.

title: BNP Paribas caught in a Cypriot money laundering investigation
summary: The French bank managed investments worth several hundred million euros on behalf of a Cypriot company that French and American investigators are looking into.

title: Ukraine strikes Russian warship in Crimean port
summary: The Kremlin acknowledged that a Ukrainian attack damaged the Novocherkassk landing ship, which Ukraine claims to have destroyed.

title: Suspect in custody after wife and four children found dead in Paris region
summary: A 33-year-old man who had previously been detained for stabbing his partner is suspected of having killed his wife and children, who were found dead at home on Christmas day.

title: French port's plan to import fish by plane from Oman causes controversy
summary: The port of Lorient wants to bolster its business by investing in the development of a 250-hectare complex. Local environmentalists are questioning the project's impact.

title: DR Congo bans opposition march against election 'irregularities'
summary: Opposition leaders are asking for the vote to be annulled, with only partial results available and logistical problems having affected some regions.

title: Navalny says he's 'fine' after transfer to Arctic penal colony
summary: Russian opposition figure Alexei Navalny said he was 'in a good mood' in a post on X, three days after his arrival in a penal colony beyond the Arctic Circle.

title: Azerbaijan expels two French diplomats
summary: The move came amid tensions during the EU-mediated peace talks following the conflict in Nagorno-Karabakh. Baku has accused France of pro-Armenian bias.

title: Kremlin tailors presidential election by removing biggest critic from the race
summary: The Central Electoral Commission refused to register Yekaterina Duntsova, who had drawn the enthusiasm of a fringe of public opinion. Moscow had done as much with Alexei Navalny, now detained in an Arctic penal colony.

title: Danièle and Marie, twins in their seventies who've been roommates for 14 years: 'We get along just fine... even if we do bicker!'
summary: 'Family portraits.' These two divorced sisters decided to move in together when they retired. They share an apartment in Metz, but not always the same pleasures or quirks.
